EmailTemplate.description: For senders to waive entitlements in favour of addressees.
EmailTemplate.name: Waiver of Entitlement
EmailTemplate.subject: Australia Post - Case: {!Case.CaseNumber}.
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Australia Post
Help & Support
Reference {!Case.CaseNumber}
We’re sorry that we couldn’t find your missing parcel and would like to compensate you for the loss.
Usually when a parcel goes missing, the sender is entitled to claim, however with your authorisation, we can issue compensation to the addressee.
What do I need to do?
Print the email and complete the below form Sign the declaration Scan and send to us by replying to this email.
What if I don’t have a scanner?
If you are unable to send your waiver to us via reply email you can send it via mail to:
Australia Post Customer Contact Centre GPO Box 9911 Melbourne VIC 3001
Please note that claims sent via mail may take longer as we need to allow processing time.
What happens next?
We will issue a Money Order to the addressee which will be sent to the below address via mail.
